newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France holds intervention rate unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France holds intervention rate unchanged.

text.p: The Bank of France said on Thursday it was leaving its intervention rate unchanged at 3.10 percent at a money market tender.
Economists had not expected a change in rates.
The Bank continued to post its five-to-10 day rate at 4.60 percent.

The intervention rate, at which the central bank allocates repo funds, was last cut -- from 3.15 percent -- on January 30, 1997. The Bank last cut its five-to-10 day emergency lending rate, by 15 basis points from 4.75 percent, on December 17, 1996.
